title: Elgin River Walk Route

images.title: The River Lossie in Elgin by Dr Richard Murray, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The River Lossie in Elgin

images.title: Anne Burgess / Cooper Park, Elgin
images.caption: Cooper Park, Elgin. The Cooper Park was gifted to the people of Elgin by George Cooper in 1903. The boating pond is popular in summer. Though it was originally intended as a skating pond, the authorities now discourage skating for safety reasons.

images.title: Footbridge over the River Loss, Elgin by JThomas, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Footbridge over the River Loss, Elgin

images.title: Des Colhoun / Bridge over the Lossie above the weir by Elgin cathedral.
images.caption: Bridge over the Lossie above the weir by Elgin cathedral.

description: This circular walk takes you along the River Lossie to visit the ruins of Elgin Cathedral. You'll also explore the pretty Cooper Park with its walking trails and lake. The walk starts in the town centre next to the bridge over the river. You can then head east along the river to the historic cathedral. The medieval cathedral is known as the ‘Lantern of the North’ and includes some extensive ruins to explore. The walk then takes you through the pleasant Cooper Park where there is a Boating pond and a Biblical garden. There is a car park here as well. You can continue your walking in the area by heading east to visit the remote Loch Oire .
display_address: A941, Bishopmill, Elgin, Moray, Alba / Scotland, IV30 4DE, United Kingdom
